background_description: You delve deep into The Woods, prying its secrets from between rough boughs and whispering leaves. In this verdant kingdom, you are no mere scholar, but its confidant as well.

Bezoar Stone.description: Ingesting it cures any poison (1 use, unless retrieved).

Delphinium.description: Breathe water for up to one hour. Can be divided into fractional doses.

Wisp Lantern.description: provides a dim light so long as the wisp is able to feed on nearby pain and fear

Briarvine.description: Entangles any creature up to horse size (STR to break free). Reusable.

starting_gear: Twine bauble (petty, Ward once per day)

table1.question: How have The Woods failed you ?

options.description: An ill-tempered forest spirit cursed you for stealing, marking you as an enemy of their kind.
A close friend, swallowed whole. Now you see their face in any tea you brew.
You were poisoned, losing your sense of taste and smell. You can now withstand noxious fumes, and always carry antitoxin.
Your radical experiments turned your skin green, and you now gain nourishment as a plant. You don't need Rations, but a day without sufficient sunlight and water leaves you deprived.
Your impressive corpseflower won a local contest, then promptly killed a judge. You fled, but not without the Prize Money and a warrant for your arrest.
You created a restorative tincture that also caused accidental infertility.

table2.question: What keeps you safe while in The Woods?

options.description: A vermillion fungus that catches fire quite easily.
Breathe water for up to one hour. Can be divided into fractional doses.
A woody reed that hardens into a permanent adhesive when chewed.
Caged in wrought iron, provides a dim light so long as the wisp is able to feed on nearby pain and fear.
A canvas sack that explodes on impact, scattering seeds. d6 damage (blast).
Entangles any creature up to horse size (STR to break free). Reusable.
